summary: This bill, HR 2121, proposes the establishment of a commission to study the potential creation of a National Museum of Irish American History. The commission would research the feasibility, cost, and location options for the museum, as well as develop a fundraising plan. The commission's findings and recommendations, including a fundraising plan and legislative proposals, would be presented to Congress. The commission will also hold a national conference. The commission will terminate 30 days after the final reports are submitted. Funding is authorized via appropriations.
